text: I usually use `{% if "/topic/" in content.absolute_url %}`

Is there a way to shorten links through HubL (get the <http://hubs.ly|hubs.ly> version) like on HubSpot's default share? I'm creating a social share link and it would be nice to have the shorter version of the URL appear - maybe a filter on the absolute_url? ```<https://twitter.com/share?url={{> content.absolute_url }}&amp;text={{ page_meta.name }}```
I dont believe there is, I am not seeing any <http://hubs.ly|hubs.ly> variables in the dev info listing
That's what I though. Oh well.
think itâ€™d be cool to get a `|hubsly` function to generate something like that
Are you checking if your on a listing page of any sort? If so, you can check for `is_listing_view` being true vs. false

This is excatly what I am doing... It looks liek with the SEO portion of HS, you can chosoe to have canonicals on pages and posts, then when it comes to listings, you get two options, no canonical or set the canonical to the first page in the listing, both options are recommended against so I am basically trying to add teh canonical via HubL. Thanks <@U6W3H6YN8> I knew there was something easier I was missing.
with the "is listing view" if I put a rss feed or anything like that on a post, it wont cause this value to switch correct?
The `is_listing_view` is only for blog templates to show what is a loop listing page (topics, authors, and main loop) and what isn't (posts)
